Container.Name: PdfDing
Container.Overview: Self-hosted PDF manager, viewer and editor offering a seamless user experience on multiple devices.
Container.Category: MediaApp:Other MediaServer:Other Productivity: Tools: Other: Status:Stable
Container.ExtraSearchTerms: pdf manager viewer editor server devices
Container.Requires: Optionally can use a separate Postgres database container, or a built-in SQLite database.

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Container Port: 8000

Config.Name: Media Path
Config.Description: Path to the media folder

Config.Name: Theme Color
Config.Description: Theme color

Config.Name: Secret Key
Config.Description: Used for securing signed data. Should be to a large random value.

Config.Name: Host Name
Config.Description: The host/domain name where PdfDing will be reachable.

Config.Name: Require User Email Verification
Config.Description: Block users until they have verified their email address.

Config.Name: Disable User Signups
Config.Description: Disable user signups

Config.Name: Database - Type
Config.Description: Database type

Config.Name: Database - Host
Config.Description: Postgres database host. Remove if using SQLite.

Config.Name: Database - Port
Config.Description: Postgres database port. Remove if using SQLite.

Config.Name: Database - Password
Config.Description: Postgres database password. Remove if using SQLite.

Config.Name: OIDC - Enable
Config.Description: Enable OpenID Connect

Config.Name: OIDC - Provider Name
Config.Description: OpenID Connect provider name

Config.Name: OIDC - Client ID
Config.Description: OpenID Connect client ID

Config.Name: OIDC - Client Secret
Config.Description: OpenID Connect client secret

Config.Name: OIDC - Auth URL
Config.Description: OpenID Connect authorization URL

Config.Name: OIDC - Enforce
Config.Description: Require users to use OIDC

Config.Name: Email - Backend
Config.Description: Whether to send account related emails, e.g a password reset or account verification, to the console or via an SMTP server.

Config.Name: Email - SMTP Host
Config.Description: SMTP server host. Remove if using the console backend.

Config.Name: Email - SMTP Port
Config.Description: SMTP server port. Remove if using the console backend.

Config.Name: Email - SMTP User
Config.Description: SMTP server user. Remove if using the console backend.

Config.Name: Email - SMTP Password
Config.Description: SMTP server password. Remove if using the console backend.

Config.Name: Email - SMTP TLS
Config.Description: Secure the connection to the SMTP server with TLS. Remove if using the console backend.

Config.Name: Email - SMTP SSL
Config.Description: Secure the connection to the SMTP server with SSL. Remove if using the console backend.

Config.Name: Consumption - Enable
Config.Description: Enable the consumption folder as an alternative way for adding PDFs.

Config.Name: Consumption - Skip Existing
Config.Description: Skip the addition PDF files if the user already has PDF with the same name and file size.

Config.Name: Consumption - Tags
Config.Description: Comma separated list of tags to add to the PDFs added via the consumption folder.

Config.Name: Backups - Enable
Config.Description: Enable periodic backups to S3 compatible storage.

Config.Name: Backups - S3 Endpoint
Config.Description: S3 compatible storage endpoint. Remove if not using backups.

Config.Name: Backups - S3 Access Key
Config.Description: S3 compatible storage access key. Remove if not using backups.

Config.Name: Backups - S3 Secret Key
Config.Description: S3 compatible storage secret key. Remove if not using backups.

Config.Name: Backups - S3 Bucket
Config.Description: S3 compatible storage bucket. Remove if not using backups.

Config.Name: Backups - Schedule
Config.Description: Cron schedule for the backups. Default is midnight every day.

Config.Name: Backups - Secure
Config.Description: Secure the connection to the S3 compatible storage with TLS.

Config.Name: Backups - Encryption
Config.Description: Encrypt the backups before uploading them to the S3 compatible storage.

Config.Name: Backups - Encryption Password
Config.Description: Password to encrypt the backups. Remove if not using encryption.

Config.Name: Backups - Encryption Salt
Config.Description: Salt to encrypt the backups. Remove if not using encryption.

Config.Name: Database Path
Config.Description: Path to the SQLite database folder. Remove if using Postgres.

Config.Name: Log Level
Config.Description: Log level

Config.Name: Secure CSRF Cookie
Config.Description: Set this to TRUE to avoid transmitting the CSRF cookie over HTTP accidentally.

Config.Name: Secure Session Cookie
Config.Description: Set this to TRUE to avoid transmitting the session cookie over HTTP accidentally.

Config.Name: Secure SSL Redirects
Config.Description: Redirects all non-HTTPS requests to HTTPS. If PdfDing is running behind a reverse proxy this can cause infinite redirects.

Config.Name: Secure HSTS Seconds
Config.Description: See details: https://github.com/mrmn2/PdfDing/blob/master/docs/configuration.md#secure_hsts_seconds

Config.Name: Default Protocol for Account
Config.Description: The default protocol for account related URLs, e.g. for the password forgotten procedure.

Config.Name: Internal Server Port
Config.Description: The port where the internal server is reachable. Not recommended to change.
